snomed_indications.reasoning: Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of hyperlipidemia, including elevated total cholesterol and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels.
Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of hypercholesterolemia, including elevated low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels.
Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of atherosclerosis, including reduction of plaque formation and progression.
Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of xanthomas, including hyperlipidemia-associated xanthomas.
Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of endarteritis, including reduction of inflammation and prevention of restenosis.

Atorvastatin is indicated for the treatment of hypertriglyceridemia, including elevated triglyceride levels.

Note: The SNOMED codes and terms used in this example are fictional and for demonstration purposes only. Actual SNOMED CT codes and terms should be used in a real-world application.
